intro: Tabernaemontana gaudichaudii, commonly known as the Madagascar star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces a milky sap that can be toxic. It thrives in tropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
